answers.answer: Silent Shingles? Nerve damage? I would see a neurologist to rule our nerve damage.If the itch is accompanied by numbness, pain, and a feeling like the tag on the back of your shirt is rubbing your skin ( but no tag is there ) it could be silent shingles. It took me years to get diagnosed.Finally one doctor asked me if I had ever been exposed to chicken pox...yup, I've had everything. So she said it was probably Silent shingles...it means shingles without the rash.Just thought I would throw those out there.Good luck.

question: My local dermatologist cannot find anything out of normal but my back continues to itch terribly all day and night.  I've tried Cerave, Hydrocortisone mixed into Cetaphil, and numbers of other over the counter creams.  I take a large number of medicines for diabetes and heart disease but she ruled those out too.Any thoughts?
